result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy S Martin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy S Martin not in court, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz appeared by video for Timothy S Martin.  Defendant's appearance waived due to court congestion.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE due to court congestion. Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10:
Defendant Timothy S Martin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Timothy S Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Brown Deer Officer Wandaogo. Direct and cross are conducted. Court ordered case adjourned for a continued preliminary hearing for the issue of identification.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Timothy S Martin appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court in person for Timothy S Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not present but a subpoena was issued. Defense Counsel motions to dismiss. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring. If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Timothy S Martin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert W Peterson appeared by video for Timothy S Martin.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 10. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with LN and her children SDJ and DXP
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an initial appearance.  Defendant does not appear.  Arrest warrant remains in effect.

Defendant Timothy S Martin in court, by zoom,  with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case needs an initial appearance.  Defendant was to appear in person.  Case remains in warrant status.  Case is adjourned to 5-4-22 at 8:30 am for an Initial Appearance in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Parties advised Court defendant was issued a new case and requests a return on warrant.  Parties notified of new court date by email.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
